element-type.name: attribute
element-type.description: The Attribute tag adds a property with the specified name and value to the component associated with the parent tag. It behaves the same as the JSF Attribute tag except that it creates a value binding for expressions instead of immediately evaluating it.

attribute-type.name: name
attribute-type.description: the name of the attribute

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the value of the attribute

element-type.name: validator
element-type.description: The Validator tag adds a new validator instance to the component associated with the parent tag. The new validator instance is found by evaluating a binding expression, or looking up a validator ID. This implements the JSF 1.2 definition of <f:validator>.

attribute-type.name: validatorId
attribute-type.description: the ID of a validator instance registered in faces-config.xml

attribute-type.name: binding
attribute-type.description: the value binding expression to a property that returns a ValidatorInstance.

element-type.name: forEach
element-type.description:
The forEach tag is a replacement for the JSTL <c:forEach> tag that works with ADF Faces components. Today, <c:forEach> cannot be used with any JSF components or tags. This tag brings that functionality to JSF, but it is limited to ADF Faces tags. This tag also has several limitations not found in <c:forEach>:
  • <af:forEach> does not currently support scenarios where the size of the "items" list or array changes from one request to the next. It may be possible to work around this in specific scenarios by manually deleting all children of the parent component (<af:selectOneListbox> in the above example), but this has not yet been tested.
  • <af:forEach> does not support arbitrary java.util.Collections; it can only iterate over java.util.Lists or arrays.
  • <af:forEach> executes at the time the JSP tag executes. So it does not have access to any EL variables that are created by JSF components. For example, the <af:table> creates an EL variable using the value of the "var" attribute. However, this EL variable is not available to <af:forEach>

attribute-type.name: items
attribute-type.description: the items over which iteration takes place

attribute-type.name: var
attribute-type.description: the name of the variable to expose

attribute-type.name: varStatus
attribute-type.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the status of the iteration.

attribute-type.name: begin
attribute-type.description: the beginning index

attribute-type.name: end
attribute-type.description: the ending index

attribute-type.name: step
attribute-type.description: the number of steps per iteration

element-type.name: setActionListener
element-type.description: The setActionListener tag provides a declarative syntax for assigning values before an action fires

attribute-type.name: to
attribute-type.description: the target for the value; must be an EL expression

attribute-type.name: from
attribute-type.description: the source of the value; can be an EL expression or a constant value

element-type.name: returnActionListener
element-type.description: The returnActionListener tag is a declarative way to allow an action source to return a value from a dialog or process.

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: The value to return as the dialog/process result. This can be an EL expression or a constant value.

element-type.name: resetActionListener
element-type.description: The resetActionListener tag provides a declarative syntax for resetting values before an action fires

element-type.name: region
element-type.description: The region tag adds components defined in a separate region file onto the current component tree. The separate region file is usually a jsp file. It is currently experimental and should not be used by developers.

attribute-type.name: regionType
attribute-type.description: Identifies which region to use. All the available regions must be declared in a region-metadata.xml file.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: This ID must be unique within this page.

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: A value to pass to the region definition.

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: Whether or not this region is rendered.

element-type.name: regionDef
element-type.description: The RegionDef tag is used to define a region. Its primary purpose is defining the "var" property of any usage of this region definition, which will be used to expose the attributes of the region into the region definition.

attribute-type.name: var
attribute-type.description: the var to set on the parent region component

element-type.name: validateRegExp
element-type.description: Validate expression using java regular expression syntax.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: pattern
attribute-type.description: pattern to be matched in the input value.

attribute-type.name: noMatchMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, when users input does not match the specified pattern.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} represents the 'pattern' expected in the input

element-type.name: selectInputText
element-type.description: The selectInputText is a text field that also supports launching a dialog to assist users in entering a value.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: searchDesc
attribute-type.description: the search description for the button that launches the dialog. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

attribute-type.name: icon
attribute-type.description: the URI for an alternative image on the button to launch the dialog

attribute-type.name: readOnly
attribute-type.description: whether the element is read-only.

attribute-type.name: disabled
attribute-type.description: whether the element is disabled.

attribute-type.name: shortDesc
attribute-type.description: the short description of the bean. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

attribute-type.name: partialTriggers
attribute-type.description: the IDs of the components that should trigger a partial update. This component will listen on the trigger components. If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too.

attribute-type.name: label
attribute-type.description: the label of the bean.

attribute-type.name: tip
attribute-type.description: the tip text associated with the control

attribute-type.name: simple
attribute-type.description: a boolean value that controls whether the component provides label and message support; when set to "true", the component will not display messaging support or the label (these attributes may be ignored: label, labelAndAccessKey, accessKey, messageDescUrl messageTargetFrame, showRequired, tip), and may use simpler layout primitives

attribute-type.name: onfocus
attribute-type.description: the event handler for when the element receives focus.

attribute-type.name: onblur
attribute-type.description: the event handler for when the element loses focus.

attribute-type.name: onchange
attribute-type.description: event handler for when the value is changed.

attribute-type.name: onclick
attribute-type.description: an onclick Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: ondblclick
attribute-type.description: an ondblclick Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: onmousedown
attribute-type.description: an onmousedown Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: onmouseup
attribute-type.description: an onmouseup Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: onmouseover
attribute-type.description: an onmouseover Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: onmousemove
attribute-type.description: an onmousemove Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: onmouseout
attribute-type.description: an onmouseout Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: onkeypress
attribute-type.description: an onkeypress Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: onkeydown
attribute-type.description: an onkeydown Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: onkeyup
attribute-type.description: an onkeyup Javascript handler.

attribute-type.name: styleClass
attribute-type.description: the CSS style class of the bean.

attribute-type.name: inlineStyle
attribute-type.description: the inline CSS style for this element

attribute-type.name: showRequired
attribute-type.description: whether the associated control displays a visual indication of required user input. If a "required" attribute is also present, both the "required" attribute and the "showRequired" attribute must be false for the visual indication not to be displayed.

attribute-type.name: valign
attribute-type.description: the vertical alignment of the label and other contents. The acceptable values are "middle", "top", and "bottom".

attribute-type.name: messageDescUrl
attribute-type.description: an URL to a page with more information about the message.

attribute-type.name: messageTargetFrame
attribute-type.description: the target frame for the message description URL, if any.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

attribute-type.name: labelAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

attribute-type.name: onselect
attribute-type.description: event handler for when text becomes selected.

attribute-type.name: columns
attribute-type.description: the number of columns to display in the text control. If no value is specified, a default of 30 columns is used. One column is approximately one character in the browser's current display font.

attribute-type.name: maximumLength
attribute-type.description: the maximum number of characters that can be entered into the text control. Note that this value is independent of the "cols" displayed.

attribute-type.name: autoSubmit
attribute-type.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.).

attribute-type.name: windowWidth
attribute-type.description: width of the window, if this command is used to launch a window.

attribute-type.name: windowHeight
attribute-type.description: height of the window, if this command is used to launch a window.

attribute-type.name: action
attribute-type.description: a reference to an action method sent by the commandButton, or the static outcome of an action

attribute-type.name: actionListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an action listener

attribute-type.name: returnListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an return listener

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description: whether the value is converted and validated immediately in the Apply Request Values phase, or in the Process Validators phase.

attribute-type.name: required
attribute-type.description: whether a non-null, non-empty value must be entered. If false, validators will not be executed when the value is null or empty.

attribute-type.name: validator
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a validator method

attribute-type.name: valueChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an value change listener

attribute-type.name: requiredMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
the message to be displayed, if 'required' validation fails.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component

attribute-type.description: the value of the component

attribute-type.description: a converter object

attribute-type.description: whether the bean is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this bean.

attribute-type.description: a binding reference to store the component instance

attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener

element-type.name: panelPage
element-type.description: PanelPage lays out an entire page.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: title
attribute-type.description: The title to display for this page.

attribute-type.name: messageType
attribute-type.description: whether page is a messaging dialog. Legal values are "error", "info", "confirmation", "warning", "processing" and "none".

attribute-type.name: chromeType
attribute-type.description: what the chromeType is for the page: compact or expanded. If compact, the brandingApp will be shown alongside the branding instead of below the branding.

attribute-type.name: quickLinksShown
attribute-type.description:
whether "quick links" will be shown for this page.

When "quickLinksShown" is set to true, the panelPage will automatically search for panelHeader's inside its contents. One quicklink will be added to each - minus the first header, and minus any headers inside other headers (a.k.a. "subheaders").

In addition, panelPage will automatically add a top-level header if the "title" attribute is set. This header is skipped over when looking for quicklinks.

This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

attribute-type.description: the IDs of the components that should trigger a partial update. This component will listen on the trigger components. If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too.

attribute-type.name: varStatus
attribute-type.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

  • square
  • decimal
  • lowerAlpha

  • none
Please keep in mind that the letters used for upperAlpha and lowerAlpha are the 26 letters of the English language, which may lead to translation problems.

If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

element-type.name: convertNumber
element-type.description: Converts an string to a Number and vice versa based on the 'pattern' or the 'type' set.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: currencyCode
attribute-type.description: The ISO 4217 currency code, applied only when formatting currencies. Currency code can also be set for the entire application in adf-faces-config.xml file. If currency code is not set on the converter, and if set on adf-faces-config.xml configuration file it will be used by calling AdfFacesContext().getCurrenctInstance().getCurrencyCode(). This currency code will be used during call to getAsString() for formatting, provided type is set to 'currency'.

attribute-type.name: convertCurrencyMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'currency' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

attribute-type.name: convertNumberMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'number' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

attribute-type.name: convertPatternMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage message, when value cannot be converted to a number, based on the pattern set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the specified conversion pattern

attribute-type.name: convertPercentMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'percent' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

attribute-type.name: currencySymbol
attribute-type.description: Currency symbol, is applied only when formatting currencies. If currency code is set then symbol will be ignored.

attribute-type.name: groupingUsed
attribute-type.description: Flag specifying whether formatted output will contain grouping separators. Default value is true.

attribute-type.name: integerOnly
attribute-type.description: Flag specifying whether only the integer part of the value will be formatted and parsed. Default value is false.

attribute-type.name: locale
attribute-type.description: Locale whose predefined styles for numbers are used during formatting and parsing. If not specified, the Locale returned by FacesContext.getViewRoot().getLocale() will be used.

attribute-type.name: maxFractionDigits
attribute-type.description: Maximum number of digits that will be formatted in the fractional portion of the output.

attribute-type.name: maxIntegerDigits
attribute-type.description: Maximum number of digits that will be formatted in the integer portion of the output.

attribute-type.name: minFractionDigits
attribute-type.description: Minimum number of digits that will be formatted in the fractional portion of the output.

attribute-type.name: minIntegerDigits
attribute-type.description: Minimum number of digits that will be formatted in the integer portion of the output.

attribute-type.name: pattern
attribute-type.description: Custom formatting pattern which determins how the number string should be formatted and parsed.

attribute-type.name: type
attribute-type.description: Specifies how the number string will be formatted and parsed. Valid values are "number", "currency", and "percent". Default value is "number".

element-type.name: validateDateTimeRange
element-type.description: Validate that the date entered is within a given range.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: maximum
attribute-type.description: the maximum java.util.Date. ISO 8601 date strings, of the form 'yyyy-MM-dd' (for example 2004-06-22) is also allowed. This will be parsed to date.

attribute-type.name: minimum
attribute-type.description: The minimum java.util.Date. ISO 8601 date strings, of the form 'yyyy-MM-dd' (for example 2004-06-22) are also allowed. This will be parsed to date.

attribute-type.name: maximumMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value exceeds the maximum value set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the maximum allowed date

attribute-type.name: minimumMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value is less than the set minimum value.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the minimum allowed date

attribute-type.name: notInRangeMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, if input value is not with in the range, when minimum and maximum is set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the minimum allowed date
  • {3} the maximum allowed date

whether or not to enable the show/hide all links above the table, which allow the user to show/hide all the detail rows. To enable the detail rows, a "detailStamp" facet must be set on this Table.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

attribute-type.description: the summary of this table's purpose and structure for user agents rendering to non-visual media.

attribute-type.name: banding
attribute-type.description:
the banding type to use on this table. Three values are allowed:
  • none: (the default) the table isn't banded
  • row: rows will be alternately banded
  • column: columns will be alternately banded

attribute-type.name: bandingInterval
attribute-type.description: the number of rows in each banding group. For example, if "bandingInterval" is set to "2", then two rows/columns will be light, followed by two that are dark, etc.

attribute-type.name: selectionState
attribute-type.description: the selection state for this component.

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description:
whether or not data validation - client-side or server-side - should take place when events are generated by this component.
When immediate is true, the default ActionListener provided by the JavaServer Faces implementation should be executed during Apply Request Values phase of the request processing lifecycle, rather than waiting until the Invoke Application phase.

attribute-type.name: disclosureListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a disclosure listener

attribute-type.name: rangeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a rangeChange listener that will be called when a new range is selected.

attribute-type.name: var
attribute-type.description: Name of the EL variable used to reference each element of this collection. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value).

attribute-type.name: varStatus
attribute-type.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

attribute-type.name: value
attribute-type.description: the data model being used by this component. The specific model class is oracle.adf.view.faces.model.CollectionModel. You may also use other model instances, e.g., java.util.List , array, and javax.faces.model.DataModel. This component will automatically convert the instance into a CollectionModel.

attribute-type.name: rows
attribute-type.description: the maximum number of rows to display in a single range of rows. Some ranges might have fewer than the number of rows specified by this attribute (eg: the last range might have an insufficient number of rows). To display all rows at once, set this attribute to 0.

attribute-type.name: first
attribute-type.description: the index of the first row in the currently range of rows. This index is zero-based. This attribute is used to control which range of rows to display to the user.

attribute-type.description: whether the bean is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this bean.

element-type.name: convertDateTime
element-type.description: Converts string into java.util.Date and vice versa based on the pattern and style set.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: convertDateMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for values that cannot be converted to date when the pattern / secondary pattern is set or when type is set to 'date' and pattern is not set or is null.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

attribute-type.name: convertTimeMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for time based value that cannot be converted to date when type is set to 'time', pattern is not set or is null

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

attribute-type.name: convertBothMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for date-time based value that cannot be converted to date when type is set to 'both' and pattern is not set or is null.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

attribute-type.name: dateStyle
attribute-type.description: Predefined formatting style which determines how the date component of a date string is to be formatted and parsed. Applied only if type is "date" or "both". Valid values are "shortish", "short", "default", "medium", "long", and "full". Default value is "shortish".

attribute-type.name: locale
attribute-type.description: Locale whose predefined styles for dates and times are used during formatting or parsing. If not specified or if null, the Locale returned by FacesContext.getViewRoot().getLocale() will be used.

attribute-type.name: pattern
attribute-type.description: Custom formatting pattern which determines how the date/time string should be formatted and parsed.

attribute-type.name: secondaryPattern
attribute-type.description: Second pattern, which will be used as a second attempt to parse a string if the primary pattern or styles fail, but is never used for formatting strings.

attribute-type.name: timeStyle
attribute-type.description: Predefined formatting style which determines how the time component of a date string is to be formatted and parsed. Applied only if type is "time" or "both". Valid values are "default", "short", "medium", "long", and "full". Default value is "short".

attribute-type.name: timeZone
attribute-type.description: Time zone in which to interpret any time information in the date string. If not set here, picks this value from adf-faces-config.xml configuration file. If not defined there, then it is defaulted to GMT.

attribute-type.name: type
attribute-type.description: Specifies what contents the string value will be formatted to include, or parsed. Valid values are "date", "time", and "both". Default value is "date".

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

attribute-type.name: labelAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

attribute-type.name: labelAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: rows
attribute-type.description: the number of rows after which to start a new column. This attribute defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE. The number of rows actually rendered depends also on the columns attribute. If the children will not fit in the given number of rows and columns, the number of rows will increase to accomodate the children. This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: maxColumns
attribute-type.description:
the maximum number of columns to show. This attribute defaults to 3 and 2 on PDAs.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: width
attribute-type.description: the preferred total width of the layout. May be specified as either a percentage or an absolute number of pixels

attribute-type.name: labelWidth
attribute-type.description:
the preferred width of the label. Usually a percentage, but may be specified as either a percentage or an absolute number of pixels. If the width is not specified, it will default appropriately. If specified as a percentage the labelWidth plus the fieldWidth should add up to 100%, regardless of the number of columns. If the labelWidth is specified and is a percentage the fieldWidth will be derived appropriately if not specified.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: fieldWidth
attribute-type.description:
the preferred width of the field. Usually a percentage, but may be specified as either a percentage or an absolute number of pixels. If the width is not specified, it will default appropriately. If specified as a percentage the labelWidth plus the fieldWidth should add up to 100%, regardless of the number of columns. If the fieldWidth is specified and is a percentage the labelWidth will be derived appropriately if not specified.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: showRequired
attribute-type.description: whether the associated control displays a visual indication of required user input. If a "required" attribute is also present, both the "required" attribute and the "showRequired" attribute must be false for the visual indication not to be displayed.

attribute-type.name: valign
attribute-type.description: the vertical alignment of the label and other contents. The acceptable values are "middle", "top", and "bottom".

attribute-type.name: messageDescUrl
attribute-type.description: an URL to a page with more information about the message.

attribute-type.name: messageTargetFrame
attribute-type.description: the target frame for the message description URL, if any.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

attribute-type.name: labelAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

attribute-type.name: autoSubmit
attribute-type.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.).

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description: whether the value is converted and validated immediately in the Apply Request Values phase, or in the Process Validators phase.

attribute-type.name: required
attribute-type.description: whether a non-null, non-empty value must be entered. If false, validators will not be executed when the value is null or empty.

attribute-type.name: validator
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a validator method

attribute-type.name: valueChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an value change listener

attribute-type.name: requiredMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
the message to be displayed, if 'required' validation fails.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: text
attribute-type.description: the textual label of the link.

attribute-type.name: disabled
attribute-type.description: whether the link should be considered disabled. This attribute only has meaning when links are used in certain container types, such as global headers and tab bars.

attribute-type.name: textAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "text" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "T&ext" will set the text to "Text" and the access key to 'e'.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this link. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple input fields in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys. Note that user agents are inconsistent about dealing with two links having same access key, and so the cycling behavior is dependent on what the user agent provides.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

The character specified by this attribute must exist in the Text attribute of this Link instance. If it does not, the user will receive no visual indication of the existence of the accessKey.

attribute-type.name: onfocus
attribute-type.description:

This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: onblur
attribute-type.description:
the event handler for the link losing the focus.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

element-type.description: The Page component is similar to the PanelPage component, except that instead of having menu1, menu2, menu3, and menuGlobal facets for adding menu information, the user binds a model object and a stamp to render these areas.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: title
attribute-type.description: The title to display for this page.

attribute-type.name: messageType
attribute-type.description: whether page is a messaging dialog. Legal values are "error", "info", "confirmation", "warning", "processing" and "none".

attribute-type.name: chromeType
attribute-type.description: what the chromeType is for the page: compact or expanded. If compact, the productBranding will be shown alongside the corporate branding instead of below the corporate branding.

attribute-type.name: quickLinksShown
attribute-type.description:
whether "quick links" will be shown for this page.

When "quickLinksShown" is set to true, the panelPage will automatically search for panelHeader's inside its contents. One quicklink will be added to each - minus the first header, and minus any headers inside other headers (a.k.a. "subheaders").

In addition, panelPage will automatically add a top-level header if the "title" attribute is set. This header is skipped over when looking for quicklinks.

This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: varStatus
attribute-type.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

attribute-type.name: banding
attribute-type.description:
the banding type to use on this table. Three values are allowed:
  • none: (the default) the table isn't banded
  • row: rows will be alternately banded
  • column: columns will be alternately banded

attribute-type.name: bandingInterval
attribute-type.description: the number of rows in each banding group. For example, if "bandingInterval" is set to "2", then two rows/columns will be light, followed by two that are dark, etc.

attribute-type.name: focusListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a focus listener

attribute-type.name: rowsByDepth
attribute-type.description:
the maximum number of records that can be displayed at one time (range size). Each level of depth in the tree can have a different range size. The first number in the array sets the range size for the root collection. Each subsequent number sets the range size for the corresponding depth. The last number becomes the default for each subsequent level of depth.
If a node has more children than the range size, navigation rows will be rendered above and below the child nodes.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this button. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple input fields in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys. Note that user agents are inconsistent about dealing with two links having same access key, and so the cycling behavior is dependent on what the user agent provides.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

The character specified by this attribute must exist in the Text attribute of this button instance. If it does not, the user will receive no visual indication of the existence of the accessKey. The easiest, and most convenient way to specify both the text and the mnemonic together is to use textAndAccessKey.

attribute-type.description: the index of the first row in the currently range of rows. This index is zero-based. This attribute is used to control which range of rows to display to the user.

attribute-type.name: textAndAccessKey

An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "text" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "T&ext" will set the text to "Text" and the access key to 'e'.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this component. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple input fields in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys. Note that user agents are inconsistent about dealing with two links having same access key, and so the cycling behavior is dependent on what the user agent provides.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

The character specified by this attribute must exist in the Text attribute of this go component instance. If it does not, the user will receive no visual indication of the existence of the accessKey.

element-type.name: column
element-type.description: Component that is used as a child of the Table component. The Column component defines the header, footer and data for a single column in the Table.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: formatType
attribute-type.description: the type of formatting to use for this column. The legal values are "text", "number" and "icon", which describe columns that display text, numbers and buttons, respectively. Text columns are left-justified, number columns are right-justified, and button columns are center-justified.

attribute-type.name: gridVisible
attribute-type.description: whether or not to display a grid line before the column's content (to the left in a left-to-right locale).

attribute-type.name: width
attribute-type.description: the preferred width of this column, e.g., "30%", "100px".

attribute-type.name: headerText
attribute-type.description: text to display in the header of the column. This is a convenience that generates output equivalent to adding a "header" facet containing an outputText.

attribute-type.name: bandingShade
attribute-type.description: the background color to use for this column. The legal values are "light" and "dark".

attribute-type.name: noWrap
attribute-type.description: whether or not the column contents should be allowed to wrap

attribute-type.name: headerNoWrap
attribute-type.description: whether or not the column header should be allowed to wrap

attribute-type.name: sortable
attribute-type.description: whether or not the column is sortable. A sortable column has a clickable header that (when clicked) sorts the table by that column's property. Note that in order for a column to be sortable, this attribute must be set to "true" and the underlying model must support sorting by this column's property. This column's "sortProperty" attribute must be set if sorting is desired.

attribute-type.name: separateRows
attribute-type.description:
whether or not the children of this column should be rendered on separate rows. Setting this attribute to true will cause each child to render in its own row. Setting this to false will cause all the children to be rendered in one cell, which will rowSpan across the rows of the Columns whose children are rendered on separate rows.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

attribute-type.name: rowHeader
attribute-type.description: Whether or not this column is a row header column.

attribute-type.name: accessKey
attribute-type.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

attribute-type.name: labelAndAccessKey
attribute-type.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description: whether the value is converted and validated immediately in the Apply Request Values phase, or in the Process Validators phase.

attribute-type.name: required
attribute-type.description: whether a non-null, non-empty value must be entered. If false, validators will not be executed when the value is null or empty.

attribute-type.name: validator
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a validator method

attribute-type.name: valueChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an value change listener

attribute-type.name: requiredMessageDetail
attribute-type.description:
the message to be displayed, if 'required' validation fails.

By default (or "soft"), multirow text wraps visually, but does not include carriage returns in the submitted value. Setting this to "off" will disable wrapping; the multirow text will scroll horizontally. Setting it to "hard" specifies that the value of the text should include any carriage returns needed to wrap the lines.

element-type.name: objectMedia
element-type.description: The objectMedia component displays media content, such as audio, video, or image in a player embedded in the user agent.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: width
attribute-type.description:
width in pixels to reserve for the media player plus its content. As the extra width needed for the media player controls can vary from media player to media player and depend on the controls displayed in the media player, it is recommended that the "innerWidth" attribute be used in preference to this attribute.

If both the "width" and "innerWidth" attributes are specified, the "width" attribute will be used.

If no width is specified, the width of the media control is determined by calculating the "innerWidth" and adding any extra width necessary to display the media player controls.

attribute-type.name: height
attribute-type.description:
height in pixels to reserve for the media player plus its content. As the extra height needed for the media player controls can vary from media player to media player and depend on the controls displayed in the media player, it is recommended that the "innerHeight" attribute be used in preference to this attribute.

If both the "height" and "innerHeight" attributes are specified, the "height" attribute will be used.

If no height is specified, the height of the media control is determined by calculating the "innerHeight" and adding any extra height necessary to display the media player controls.

attribute-type.name: innerWidth
attribute-type.description:
width in pixels to reserve for the media player content. This will typically be set to the pixel width of the media resource to display.

If no "innerWidth" is specified, the "innerWidth" will be defaulted based on the content type of the media resource to play.

If both the "width" and "innerWidth" attributes are specified, the "width" attribute will be used.

attribute-type.name: innerHeight
attribute-type.description:
height in pixels to reserve for the media player content. This will typically be set to the pixel height of the media resource to display.

If no "innerHeight" is specified, the "innerHeight" will be defaulted based on the content type of the media resource to play.

If both the "height" and "innerHeight" attributes are specified, the "height" attribute will be used.

attribute-type.name: source
attribute-type.description: the URI specifying the location of the media resource. If no contentType is specified, the contentType will be inferred from the extension of the source attribute.

attribute-type.name: autostart
attribute-type.description: a boolean value that controls whether the media resource loads and plays automatically without user initiation. When set to "true", the media resource will load and play as soon as possible.

attribute-type.name: playCount
attribute-type.description: the number of times the media resource will play. If set to "0", the resource will loop until the user stops the playing.

attribute-type.name: contentType
attribute-type.description: the MIME type of the media content returned by the "source" URI. This attribute is used as a hint when determining which player to pick, how the controls of the player are to be configured, and the default size of the media player. If it isn't specified, an attempt will be made to derive this information from the extension of the source URI.

attribute-type.name: standbyText
attribute-type.description: Message to display in the media player while the media resource is loading.

attribute-type.name: player
attribute-type.description:
which media player to use to play the media resource. If possible, the media control will accomodate this request. However, if the requested player is not available on the user agent, or does not support playing the media resource, an alternate player will be used instead. In all cases, the "link" player is used as a fallback if no other player is available, or the requested player fails for some reason.
  • "none"

    use a link in the user agent page to launch the playing of the media resource.

    This player setting uses the least amount of space on the page and uses the user agent's built in content type mapping to determine how to display the media resource.

  • "quicktime"

    use the Apple QuickTime player.

  • "windows"

    use the Windows Media Player.

  • "real"

    use the Real Player.

attribute-type.name: controls
attribute-type.description:
the set of controls made available to the user for controlling the media playback. The actual set of controls displayed for the same value may differ between players. Likewise, the amount of space occupied by the controls will differ from media player to media player. This can cause problems if the size of the media control has been specified by the "width" and "height" attributes rather than "innerWidth" and "innerHeight".
  • "none"

    don't show any controls for the media player and don't allow control access through alternate means, such as context menus.

    This value is typically only used in kiosk-type applications where no user control over the playing of the media is allowed. It is typically used in conjunction with setting the "autostart" attribute to "true", and the "playCount" attribute to "0" to cause the media play immediately and then loop.

  • "noneVisible"

    don't show any controls for the media player but allow control access through alternate means, such as context menus.

    This value is typically only used in applications where user control over the playing of the media is allowed, but not encouraged. It is typically used in conjunction with setting the "autostart" attribute to "true", and the "playCount" attribute to "0" to cause the media to play immediately and then loop.

  • "minimal"

    show a minimal set of controls for playing media on the media player.

    This value gives users control over the most important media playing controls, while occupying the least amount of additional space on the user agent.

  • "typical"

    show the typical set of controls for playing media on the media player.

    This value, the default, gives users control over the most common media playing controls, without occupying an inordinate amount of extra space on the user agent.

  • "all"

    Show all available controls for playing media on the media player

    Using this setting can cause large amount of additional space to be required, depending on the media player used.

The default of this attribute is "typical".

attribute-type.description: a binding reference to store the component instance

attribute-type.name: attributeChangeListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener

element-type.name: poll
element-type.description: This components polls the server periodically so that any dependent components get a chance to update themselves.

attribute-type.name: id
attribute-type.description: the identifier for the component

attribute-type.name: interval
attribute-type.description: the time between poll events, in milliseconds. The default is 5000. If in screen-reader mode, make sure the interval is long enough for the screen reader to read through the re-render before a new poll occurs.

attribute-type.name: immediate
attribute-type.description:
whether or not data validation - client-side or server-side - should take place when events are generated by this component.
When immediate is true, the default ActionListener provided by the JavaServer Faces implementation should be executed during Apply Request Values phase of the request processing lifecycle, rather than waiting until the Invoke Application phase.

attribute-type.name: pollListener
attribute-type.description: a method reference to a poll listener

attribute-type.name: rendered
attribute-type.description: whether the bean is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this bean.

attribute-type.description: a binding reference to store the component instance
